commit_message:
Rollup and remove unsupported releases

OpenStack releases < icehouse are no longer supported by the charms;
rollup and remove any templates for older releases.

Change-Id: I2e184c22dc9bca3a3dc0532bbe72948a11e330f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-glance refs/changes/49/288449/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
py26/py33 are no longer supported by Infra's CI

Python 3.3/2.6 support would be dropped by
Infra team from mitaka,CI would no longer be testing it,
so projects should drop it also.

Change-Id: I694e5ae76a5d68ba49f484f626d21d00f5f2d3ec
Closes-Bug: #1519510
Closes-Bug: #1526170

commit_message:
remove python 2.6 trove classifier

OpenStack projects are no longer being tested under Python 2.6, so
remove the trove classifier implying that this project supports 2.6.

Change-Id: I3d4f4c69aa0f1e3489f9780e53ebd3883705eafa

subject: Use LiveMigrateData object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 22:27:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/d2d655401956fdd5a2f36d000621c6e5d3f59730', 'message': "Use LiveMigrateData object

Nova now sends LiveMigrateData objects exclusively to pass data
between the compute managers and conductor during live migration.
Since dicts are no longer supported the conversion to objects
must be done to continue to support live migration.

There are multiple parts of this conversion.

- Create a PowerVMLiveMigrateData object.  This object must be
'registered' in both the compute manager and conductor in order
for it to be sent over the wire. It can be registered in the
compute manager by importing it in the compute driver, but for
conductor there is no way to dynamically load it.  This forces
the use of a unique PowerVM conductor manager for that sole
purpose.

- Update the live migration code to return and accept the new
PowerVMLiveMigrateData object. As part of that conversion, it's
no longer necessary to pass both a source and destination copy
of the data. It's now, just one object.

- Update the volume drivers to accept the object.  The drivers
were not using the data provide in most of the object so limit
them to just a dict of volume data they can originate and
consume.

Work not covered:

- There has been limited real system testing of migration of
VMs with attached volumes.

- Updates to the devstack code to enable the PowerVM specific
version of conductor.

Change-Id: I58e3cd3cf83a5089399b093202d88e17cfcb2bf2

commit_message:
Use LiveMigrateData object

Nova now sends LiveMigrateData objects exclusively to pass data
between the compute managers and conductor during live migration.
Since dicts are no longer supported the conversion to objects
must be done to continue to support live migration.

There are multiple parts of this conversion.

- Create a PowerVMLiveMigrateData object.  This object must be
'registered' in both the compute manager and conductor in order
for it to be sent over the wire. It can be registered in the
compute manager by importing it in the compute driver, but for
conductor there is no way to dynamically load it.  This forces
the use of a unique PowerVM conductor manager for that sole
purpose.

- Update the live migration code to return and accept the new
PowerVMLiveMigrateData object. As part of that conversion, it's
no longer necessary to pass both a source and destination copy
of the data. It's now just one object.

- Update the volume drivers to accept the object.  The drivers
were not using the data provided in most of the object so limit
them to just a dict of volume data they can originate and
consume.

Work not covered:

- There has been limited real system testing of migration of
VMs with attached volumes.

- Updates to the devstack code to enable the PowerVM specific
version of conductor.

Partial-Bug: #1551954
Change-Id: I58e3cd3cf83a5089399b093202d88e17cfcb2bf2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/64/284964/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Set the ssh auth key. mgmt_task.add_authorized_key(self.drvr.adapter, migrate_data.public_key) vol_drv.pre_live_migration_on_destination( migrate_data.vol_data) self.pre_live_vol_data = migrate_data.vol_data return migrate_data vol_drv.cleanup_volume_at_destination(self.pre_live_vol_data) :returns: a PowerVMLiveMigrateData object LOG.debug('Dest Migration data: %s' % self.mig_data) self.mig_data.dest_proc_compat.split(',')): self.mig_data.dest_proc_compat.split(',')))) self.mig_data.public_key = mgmt_task.get_public_key(self.drvr.adapter) # Get the 'source' pre-migration data for the volume drivers. vol_data = {} for vol_drv in vol_drvs: vol_drv.pre_live_migration_on_source(vol_data) self.mig_data.vol_data = vol_data LOG.debug('Src Migration data: %s' % self.mig_data) return self.mig_data :param migrate_data: a PowerVMLiveMigrateData object LOG.debug("Migrate data passed in: %s" % migrate_data) LOG.debug("Our self.mig_data: %s" % self.mig_data) # The passed in mig data has more info, so replace self.mig_data = migrate_data vol_data = migrate_data.vol_data vfc_mappings = vol_data.get('vfc_lpm_mappings') vscsi_mappings = vol_data.get('vscsi_lpm_mappings') mig.migrate_lpar(self.lpar_w, self.mig_data.dest_sys_name, tgt_mgmt_svr=self.mig_data.dest_ip, tgt_mgmt_usr=self.mig_data.dest_user_id, :param migrate_data: a PowerVMLiveMigrateData object ready, msg = lpar_w.can_lpm(host_w, migr_data=self.mig_data.host_mig_data)

Should # automatically update the mig_data dictionary as needed. for vol_drv in vol_drvs: vol_drv.pre_live_migration_on_source(mig_data) return self.src_data :param migrate_data: migration data from src and dest host. LOG.debug("Migrate data: %s" % migrate_data) dest_pre_lm_data = migrate_data.get('pre_live_migration_result', {}) vfc_mappings = dest_pre_lm_data.get('vfc_lpm_mappings') vscsi_mappings = dest_pre_lm_data.get('vscsi_lpm_mappings') mig.migrate_lpar(self.lpar_w, self.dest_data['dest_sys_name'], tgt_mgmt_svr=self.dest_data['dest_ip'], tgt_mgmt_usr=self.dest_data.get('dest_user_id'), :param migrate_data: migration data ready, msg = lpar_w.can_lpm(host_w, migr_data=( self.dest_data.get('dest_host_migr_data')))

subject: Remove openrc each time before usual ran of keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 09:52:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/659f41736408a0c83b1ea22bf39dcc35feffb482', 'message': 'Remove openrc each time before usual ran of keystone

Create new task which ensure to remove existent /root/openrc
file before run keystone manifest.

Rationale of this is the fact that all keystone resources (endpoints,
for example) created now with help from openstacklib provider. If it
founds /root/openrc file then it tries to get auth url from it and
then get keystone admin endpoint from catalog. But if we change scheme
of admin endpoint itself (it is actual for selective ssl tasks), then
to this moment our endpoint already changed at load-balancer side, so
all tries to change it with old endpoint from catalog will fail.

But if /root/openrc is not exists, openstacklib tries to construct
auth data from keystone config - and it always already have right data
at this moment. So we just try remove /root/openrc before run keystone
task.

Change-Id: I494ebdcf11d8acfec2285256b2bf5b03bd251d0a
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-02 13:28:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/8b5a615e0de325128e961898594bf3a90b7693e5', 'message': 'Remove openrc each time before usual ran of keystone

all tries to change it with old endpoint from catalog will fail.

But if /root/openrc is not exists, openstacklib tries to construct
auth data from keystone config - and it always already have right data
at this moment. So we just try remove /root/openrc before run keystone
task.

Change-Id: I494ebdcf11d8acfec2285256b2bf5b03bd251d0a
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency
'}]
commit_message:
Remove openrc each time before usual ran of keystone

Create new task which ensure to remove existent /root/openrc
file before run keystone manifest.

Rationale of this is the fact that all keystone resources (endpoints,
for example) created now with help from openstacklib provider. If it
founds /root/openrc file then it tries to get auth url from it and
then get keystone admin endpoint from catalog. But if we change scheme
of admin endpoint itself (it is actual for selective ssl tasks), then
to this moment our endpoint already changed at load-balancer side, so
all tries to change it with old endpoint from catalog will fail.

But if /root/openrc is not exists, openstacklib tries to construct
auth data from keystone config - and it always already have right data
at this moment. So we just try remove /root/openrc before run keystone
task.

Change-Id: I494ebdcf11d8acfec2285256b2bf5b03bd251d0a
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/63/287063/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' require 'shared-examples' manifest = 'keystone/openrc_delete.pp' describe manifest do shared_examples 'catalog' do openrc = '/root/openrc' it "should remove #{openrc} file" do should contain_file(openrc).with('ensure' => 'absent') end end test_ubuntu_and_centos manifest end

commit_message:
Deprecate outdated options

- auth_plugin option was deprecated if favor of auth_type
- lock_path should be set in oslo_concurrency section

Change-Id: I3997dae2bafce3c08fad6e0a820a430db85a0dee

commit_message:
Enable SSL termination for all services

This change makes it so that all services are expecting SSL termination
at the load balancer by default. This is more indicative of how a real
world deployment will be setup and is being added such that we can test
a more production like deployment system by default.

The AIO will now terminate SSL in HAProxy using a self-signed cert.

Change-Id: Ibbeca3325947b549ae00d11e60bf719741b4b0e4
Re-Implementation-Of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277199/9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove dangling Default domain cfg file

The multi-domain LDAP support added in 12.0.6 left behind a
keystone.Default.conf file that causes Keystone errors when adding a
new domain backed by LDAP. This patch removes the file unless the
deployer has specifically created a domain called 'Default'.

This is a combined backport of:
 - https://review.openstack.org/287440 (patch)
 - https://review.openstack.org/287444 (release notes)

Closes-bug: 1547542

Change-Id: I28cbd9afece968002db10e899c5172f1fd3dcc1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/58/288458/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fixes: - The addition of multi-domain LDAP configuration support left behind a configuration file for the default domain that causes problems with Keystone. This file will automatically be removed if the deployer is not using the Default domain with an LDAP back end. (`Bug 1547542 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1547542>`_)

commit_message:
Use db connection from RequestContext during queries

Now that db connections can be specified through the RequestContext,
any queries on tables that reside in cell dbs must use the methods
provided to create transaction context managers on-the-fly using the
db connection from the RequestContext instead of using the
"main_context_manager" for all accesses. The get_context_manager()
method returns the main_context_manager if no db connection is
found in the RequestContext, so things continue to work even when
no cell dbs exist.

The tables that reside in cell dbs are based on the Cells v2
database split doc [1].

Related to blueprint cells-db-connection-switching

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277543

Change-Id: I4452116ae0c88ba18672839f2856247092bf6b9a

commit_message:
Enable SSL termination for all services

This change makes it so that all services are expecting SSL termination
at the load balancer by default. This is more indicative of how a real
world deployment will be setup and is being added such that we can test
a more production like deployment system by default.

The AIO will now terminate SSL in HAProxy using a self-signed cert.

Change-Id: Ifde735a35af50befe12d9d17ba768e61c67eecf9
Re-Implementation-Of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/277199/9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Adds the upgrade of any stand-alone swift nodes before controllers

It seems consensus is we should update all swift-* services before
the swift-proxy. The implication is that we need to upgrade the
object-storage nodes before controllers (proxy runs on controllers).

This introduces a ObjectStorageUpgradeDeployment into the upgrade
workflow to do that. It also moves the stop/start of the swift
services into the common_functions file.

Change-Id: Ia8a95aaf31dcb4525a793414d9ca40806eedf305

commit_message:
Improve keystone::wsgi spec for testing headers parameter

Change I0d1ca6b11d9ba5b03c92dff728e0edc3bd06cc19 was occasionaly merged
without adding tests for header, this patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I9a4b7bc5564a2208397a7ff1a58bd5f0600eab37

commit_message:
Switch most python jobs to ubuntu-trusty

The following job-templates have been tested in experimental on 3
branches each of 14 common Python-based projects (7 clients, 7
servers), and confirmed to run equivalently on minimal ubuntu-trusty
nodes with these changes:

    gate-{name}-coverage
    gate-{name}-pep8
    gate-{name}-python27
    gate-{name}-python34
    gate-{name}-pypy
    gate-{name}-docs
    gate-{name}-requirements

Switch them to ubuntu-trusty in production now.

commit_message:
[Docs] Rework "Rally Plugins Reference"

- Add "Contents" add the top of page
- Mark each group of plugin as a Category and make it's name as a link
- Mark each plugin as a Sub-category and make it's name as a link
- Parse plugin description and parameters instead of displaying them as quotes
- Add pluging's namespaces
- Add references to github for each plugin module
- Add "Table Of Contents" sidebar(already used at readthedocs, but was missed
  from http://docs.openstack.org/developer/rally/)

Change-Id: I8889ccc7f82b0f46495ce607c242d37242360a25

commit_message:
Upperbound on setuptools at 20.1.1

Upperbound on setuptools to avoid the problem of having whitepace between
requirement version conditions introduced on the version 20.2.1

Closes-Bug: #1548591

commit_message:
libvirt: make snapshot use RBD snapshot/clone when available

When rbd is used for ephemeral disks and image storage, make snapshot
use ceph directly, and update glance with the new location.  In
case of failure, it will gracefully fallback to the "generic"
snapshot method.

This requires changing the typical permissions for the nova ceph
user (if using authx) to allow writing to the pool where vm images
are stored, and it also requires configuring Glance to provide a
v2 endpoint with direct_url support enabled (there are security
implications to doing this).

Spec: Ia3666d53e663eacf8c65dbffbd4bc847dd948171

DocImpact: Ceph and Glance configuration changes
Implements: blueprint rbd-instance-snapshots
Change-Id: If13d25b6c94e247d2505583b524ae3af9c34b5dc
(cherry picked from commit 824c3706a3ea691781f4fcc4453881517a9e1c55)

commit_message:
Use use_forwarded_for in manila config

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286876 the use_forwarded_for
option was removed from the Manila configuration. Manila does support
that option so it should be kept for logs to include the appropriate
clien IP address.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0279ad24a2331ce7e6e292549013b9553fe1a6f3
Related-Bug: #1548935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/78/288478/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: use_forwarded_for = true

subject: Revert "Generate better validation error message when using name regexes"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 21:02:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/validation/validators.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/api/validation/parameter_types.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_api_validation.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/09d27bdf2d1d280787e8bb875ec50b5bdaf49e25', 'message': 'Revert "Generate better validation error message when using name regexes"

This reverts commit 8093549e58e1c2de03e29aefa5bf5d1d71f31324.

some command like nova aggregate-create foo will fail
guess the reason is we honor the format of the parameter
but it's possible to set the type like following 
availability_zone['type'] = ['string', 'null']
which makes the input 
{"aggregate": {"name": "foo", "availability_zone": null}}
is also valid

so in the following code, re.search encounter a NONE value
and raise a TypeError

@jsonschema.FormatChecker.cls_checks('name', exception.InvalidName)
def _validate_name(instance):
    regex = parameter_types.valid_name_regex
    if re.search(regex.regex, instance):


guess we can copy additional code from jsonschema but that need additional effort.

Change-Id: I69619c1b5a5dd3b239100fc52cb65488fbc72609
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Generate better validation error message when using name regexes"

This reverts commit 8093549e58e1c2de03e29aefa5bf5d1d71f31324.

some command like nova aggregate-create foo will fail
guess the reason is we honor the format of the parameter
but it's possible to set the type like following 
availability_zone['type'] = ['string', 'null']
which makes the input 
{"aggregate": {"name": "foo", "availability_zone": null}}
is also valid

so in the following code, re.search encounter a NONE value
and raise a TypeError

@jsonschema.FormatChecker.cls_checks('name', exception.InvalidName)
def _validate_name(instance):
    regex = parameter_types.valid_name_regex
    if re.search(regex.regex, instance):


guess we can copy additional code from jsonschema but that need additional effort.

Change-Id: I69619c1b5a5dd3b239100fc52cb65488fbc72609

Change-Id: Id287c49aa182b525b40e6b97bc59ed17e61c1a8a

commit_message:
Increase min-ready for ubuntu-trusty

We're putting more jobs on ubuntu-trusty, increase min-ready from 1 to 4
to have more images available.

Once the conversion is done, we need to reduce bare-trusty min-ready.

Change-Id: Id287c49aa182b525b40e6b97bc59ed17e61c1a8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/27/288427/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Reorganise Python according to Horizon plugin doc

Moved Python from ironic_ui/ironic to ironic_ui/content/ironic.
Rename API files according to Horizon plugin doc.

Co-Authored-By: Peter Piela <ppiela@cray.com>

commit_message:
Allow to pass the ceph secret

Allow to pass the ceph secret instead of a keyring file.

Closes-bug: #1548894
Change-Id: I576924ed9595b403171ffc8be8156ab5416b2caa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/75/287675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $GNOCCHI_CONF storage ceph_secret $(awk '/key/{print $3}' ${CEPH_CONF_DIR}/ceph.client.${GNOCCHI_CEPH_USER}.keyring)

subject: Fix pecan collection->plugin map for extensions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 06:17:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f8d62c9c4e32b7c74c4c94ead0dedaca2d7ed06e', 'message': "Fix pecan collection->plugin map for extensions

The way pecan was mapping collections to plugins always assumed
that the same plugin that supported an extension that extended
a given collection was responsible for the collection itself.
This isn't the case for extensions that just add data to a
collection via the dictionary extension mechanisms. For example,
the timestamps are implemented in an extension that is run by
a standalone service plugin that just performs DB updates via
DB hooks and gives the responses to users via the dictionary
extension hooks.

This patch fixes it by checking to ensure the plugin actually
supports the get method for the collection itself before assuming
that the collection belongs to the plugin.

commit_message:
Fix pecan collection->plugin map for extensions

The way pecan was mapping collections to plugins always assumed
that the same plugin that supported an extension that extended
a given collection was responsible for the collection itself.
This isn't the case for extensions that just add data to a
collection via the dictionary extension mechanisms. For example,
the timestamps are implemented in an extension that is run by
a standalone service plugin that just performs DB updates via
DB hooks and gives the responses to users via the dictionary
extension hooks.

This patch fixes it by checking to ensure the plugin actually
supports the get method for the collection itself before assuming
that the collection belongs to the plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1552926
Change-Id: I22fa396e1ccd6af936fd4d58bbb0638ff5ab4467
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/11/287611/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # because of 'attribute' extensions. These extensions may come from # various plugins and only one of them is the primary one responsible # for the resource while the others just append fields to the response # (e.g. timestamps). So we have to find the plugin that supports the # extension and has the getter for the collection. collection in ext.get_extended_resources('2.0')) if (alias in ext_res_mappings and hasattr(plugin, 'get_%s' % collection)):
deleted_lines: from neutron.extensions import quotasv2 # because of 'attribute' extensions. Due to the way in which neutron # plugins and request dispatching is constructed, it is impossible for # the same resource to be handled by more than one plugin. Therefore # all the extensions mapped to a given resource will necessarily be # implemented by the same plugin. # Also, quotas are peculiar, as they are not handled by any plugin. # However, since plugins list quotas among the extensions they support # this implies that the Pecan server at startup might believe the core # plugin handles quotas too. The following also ensures no plugin is # ever associate wiht the 'quotas' extension. collection in ext.get_extended_resources('2.0') and collection != quotasv2.RESOURCE_COLLECTION) if alias in ext_res_mappings:

commit_message:
Change unstable neutron rally job's flavors

To relieve memory pressure, the unstable neutron rally job's
flavors were changed from m1.tiny to m1.nano.

Change-Id: I7e687172d1cdd5d0e0421d936ebffa4965b3082f
Closes-Bug: #1544730

commit_message:
Flush journalctl logs before fetching them during introspection

Sometimes ironic-inspector receives incomplete logs. Trying calling
journalctl with --flush option before to fix it.

Change-Id: Ie6bf2982579e982cdd65aba84bff9e6c966ae534

commit_message:
Fix ironic-inspector client usage

Right now we are using the ironic-inspector-client functions directly with
providing the auth token. This is deprecated in favor of providing the session.
However, inside the OSC plugin the introspection client is already available,
so just use it directly. This patch also stops redefining --inspector-url which
is already defined by ironic-inspector-client.

Change-Id: I9538e32967103f71c2af94077eb1994462a88d18

commit_message:
Add backup action

Add a new action to backup the pxc database on a unit.

Backups by default are stored in /opt/backups/mysql and can
optionally be compressed and done as incremental backups.

Change-Id: I5c6ab9fd8be7cb6cdb2a26e849ec0b22d8d4f9a6

commit_message:
Add Ipv6 support

Adds support for configuring the Rados Gateway to use IPv6
addresses and networks. This can be enabled by setting
prefer-ipv6=True.

Change-Id: I801fab14accd8c3498ea5468d135f34f159717cb
Closes-Bug: 1513524
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-radosgw refs/changes/62/287162/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: prefer-ipv6: type: boolean default: False description: | If True enables IPv6 support. The charm will expect network interfaces to be configured with an IPv6 address. If set to False (default) IPv4 is expected. . NOTE: these charms do not currently support IPv6 privacy extension. In order for this charm to function correctly, the privacy extension must be disabled and a non-temporary address must be configured/available on your network interface.

commit_message:
Replace copy.deepcopy of RequestContext with copy.copy

Instance of RequestContext contains many objects and some of them like
mutexes could not be copied. Also a deepcopy of the entire
RequestContext wastes CPU time.

To avoid problems with deepcopy and avoid performance overhead this
patch changes deepcopy of RequestContext to shallow copy and makes
deepcopy of only the 'roles' member because of security issue
LP #1386932.

Closes-Bug: #1506958
Related-Bug: #1386932
Change-Id: I1e2c00e95e1c4bcd0ec7bf075458789d6fb06e99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/260615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context = copy.copy(self) # context.roles must be deepcopied to leave original roles # without changes context.roles = copy.deepcopy(self.roles)

commit_message:
Fix argument when calling inventory script

The dynamic inventory script was updated to use the `--config` argument
in place of the `--file` argument. This change corrects that usage
within the dynamic inventory testing.

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib clients for bulk ops

We have duplicated bulk ops code on tempest.lib and network_client
module. So this patch removes these methods from the module and
makes tests use tempest.lib ones for the code cleanup.

Change-Id: I685be88bbd47837d99b49938cfaa66ff2e199cb3

Fix decoding response data string for python 3

This commit fixes decoding response data string for python 3. Most of
all are already fixed in [1]. But we missed this because we didn't have
a python 3 job at that time.

[1] I769ec784f87a311eef52df09cd96fdbfed9cba1c

Change-Id: I679bf56642c927cf635507815694c823f3c303a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/83/288283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: response_data = json.loads(res.data.decode('utf-8'))

commit_message:
Support export location metadata in NetApp cDOT drivers

Since the export location metadata feature has merged in Manila core,
we can support it in the NetApp drivers. The initial need is to
report which paths are preferred.

Implements: blueprint netapp-cdot-export-location-metadata
Depends-On: Ibb88c64ddd899c09cd148f398e21ac613be9f15b
Change-Id: I77e3a6464c6da59cfafa34bd23c23740efbcf7c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/07/280807/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Skip schema validation on GET /v2/images/%s

These are server-generated, not user-generated, and schema validation
should not be necessary.

Rework a unit test that enforces this; bad data should be blocked
at ingest, not blocked on reads.

Co-authored-by: Stuart McLaren <stuart.mclaren@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ib1926fec0e858b6eed43c7931a6d6c3a1708e70e
Closes-Bug: 1501046

commit_message:
Changed logger init and added verbose arg handling

Initialized logger with default value of NOTSET.

Added if statement to handle verbose argument and set the logger to
DEBUG.

Change-Id: I997b8b964dade013db265d088d00ccfdd6ab030e
Closes-Bug: #1269465

commit_message:
Disable caching for blkid calls

blkid saves block device metadata cache to a file (default location is
/dev/.blkid.tab). Because of the probabilistic nature of UUID collision
bug (which causes blkid to misinterpret partition metadata structures)
we need to make sure that all data read by blkid comes from the actual
device, not from the cache.

Passing "-c /dev/null" effectively suppresses the blkid caching.

Change-Id: I9e740286ffefb780d06437ed8e56b5f73ad6fa97
Partial-Bug: 1550227
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/95/287695/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'blkid', '-c', '/dev/null', '-o', 'value', '-s', 'UUID', fs.device,

commit_message:
Switch to ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty for ansible jobs

Here we are switching to ubuntu-trusty as our base image, this will
allow us to retire the bare-trusty node.

Change-Id: I80648a9176d6adb759dffb7545ec0cd100d2d60b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Improve performance of resource report creating
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 18:13:02.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/ceilometer.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/utils/metering.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/88443906d42687181b18e6bb78ab892db38a0961', 'message': 'Improve performance of resource report creating

Currently for making ResourceUsage charts and reports
Horizon makes some nonoptimal requests to ceilometer-api

1. Hundreds (projects or resource count) statistics requests.
Statistics request is long operation that may take a long time
with large time range. Now these requests are called via
ThreadPool. These requests may make all ceilometer-api workers busy
and crash over requests.
In this CR we make one batch request and collect data from its response.

2. Hardcoded period = 1 day.
For charts with minimum periods which equal 1 day or 1 hour
it is too big period.
In this CR we used already created function calc_period which
use period = total_seconds/400

Change-Id: I6e4b43a00b271b9575d86c73fe91864cf6c1f72c
Partially-closes: bug #1444456
'}]
commit_message:
Improve performance of resource report creating

Currently for making ResourceUsage charts and reports
Horizon makes some nonoptimal requests to ceilometer-api

1. Hundreds (projects or resource count) statistics requests.
Statistics request is long operation that may take a long time
with large time range. Now these requests are called via
ThreadPool. These requests may make all ceilometer-api workers busy
and crash over requests.
In this CR we make one batch request and collect data from its response.

2. Hardcoded period = 1 day.
For charts with minimum periods which equal 1 day or 1 hour
it is too big period.
In this CR we used already created function calc_period which
use period = total_seconds/400

Change-Id: I6e4b43a00b271b9575d86c73fe91864cf6c1f72c
Partially-closes: bug #1444456

commit_message:
[unittest] Add tests for ceilometer.cmd

Currently we don't test ceilometer.cmd modules.
This CR intended to correct it.
Added tests for starting polling agents, alarms,
collector and notification services and storage utils.

Change-Id: I3ea5d7690903340223940cf441db145819050aab

commit_message:
Add resource_metadata for generated samples

These changes need for testing gnocchi dispatcher because in
gnocchi some metadata fields are required. In this CR
send_test_data script generate metadata for every resource.
Also this script send resource_list to pipeline if we need to
get resource list in parent process.

Change-Id: If6c8d11d23d364cdd318992a6e81e867114aad75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/50/150450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add a storing of resource id for events

This field are required for follow proccesing events which relative
to same resource (event transformers and event statistics). It is
configured in event_definition and may define via fields jsonpath,
which are taken from notification_body or via traits which use exists traits.

Change-Id: Ib02aeaa7ea5bd1e9ff5d8033afee5b85c0037886

commit_message:
Add a 1 hour period to "metering" dashboard

Currently we use "7 day" period by default in stats tab.
On huge amount of data it's may freeze the horizon and ceilometer api.
In this CR the "1 hour" period have been added and set by default.
It helps to avoid api freeze in dashboard opening and improve user
experience for this dashboard.

Related-bug: #1444456

Change-Id: I74163120248efce80e4d2ea69a18d76dcc7f579d

commit_message:
Fix InfluxDB tests

Now, InfluxDB tests are failing via Timeout error on writing
or getting data. It is caused by internal multithreading locks which
relative to measurements dropping. Also, these locks happen then
we drop measurements due the active writing measures to the current db.

So, in this patchset we avoid to drop measurements and expect that it
will deleting via retention.
For every test we use new database and it allows to use
isolated data for every test.

Also, in this CR timestamp query format have been changed for
compatibility with current Gnocchi tests.

Change-Id: I324a8a1f1b767ecc1a00c3b73a4612a4467842ef
Relative-to: bug #1488027
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/28/230928/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Split ceilometer pipeline to the new project

blueprint split-ceilometer-pipeline

Change-Id: I6197c1a3f494eafdfd5a9b1df746c44660010403
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/14/246314/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Ceilometer pipeline splitting ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/split-ceilometer-pipeline Despite the alarm splitting Ceilometer has a lot of components with different responsibilities still. This spec aims to continue Ceilometer separation to smaller projects and move Ceilometer pipeline to the new project. It will include a polling and notification agents which transform samples/events and provide normalised data to other services. Pipeline separation bring the benefits for different sides of Telemetry: * Make code smaller and easier to understand and maintain. * Project test process simplifying. * Pipeline project can provide a normalized metrics for any listener who wants to use ceilometer samples/events. This new package is comprised of the following agents: * Polling Agent. This agent(s) polls data from the requested sources at a given interval and produces messages containing the data for consumption to the Ceilometer notification agent. It coordinates across the all the pollsters to load-balance work. * Notification Agent. This agent(s) gets and tranform notifications from other services to Ceilometer samples/events according to the declarative rules. It also have a HA coordination. Problem description =================== Ceilometer is performing several functions as a single service with many agents. These functions can be inter-connected and leveraged but are quite different in nature and this constitutes a maintenance and deployment problem, especially in environments where Ceilomter is only used for a single task. Splitting the components so that comprehension and depoloyment of the services is simpler is a clear advantage. There is implemented `alarm spec`_ that is addressing the split of the alarm capabilities for the autoscaling needs.: .. _alarm spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/184307/ Proposed change =============== The proposed change is to create a dedicated Openstack project that contains only pipeline agents. Since Liberty there are two agents: ceilometer-polling and ceilometer-agent-notification. Also, with agents meters, events and pipeline config files will be moved. These ceilometer files declare polling rules and notification transformations to the samples and events. Alternatives ------------ An alternative is to keep these agents in ceilometer repo and only prepare a easy way for deploying these agents with disabled Ceilometer storage layer, but this solution keeps all the disadvantages of the current codebase. Data model impact ----------------- Currently none. Agents don't store any data in storages. REST API impact --------------- None. Agents are API-less. Security impact --------------- There is a security improvement since less credentials need to be added in the configuration files. Pipeline impact --------------- None. Pipeline save current format, but only move to another project. Other end user impact --------------------- End users can use rich and developed pipeline as a separately project for providing Ceilometer data to another projects or systems. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- Performance and Scalabilty are the same as before. Other deployer impact --------------------- The pipeline configurations and declarations should be moved to new project. Configuration files for polling and notification should be split out of `ceilometer.conf`. The subsystem will be released independently than Ceilometer on its own schedule, like it's already the case for Gnocchi and now other OpenStack projects. A coordinated release at the end of each cycle will happen too. Developer impact ---------------- The new code repository hosting Ceilometer pipeline will require a new core review team. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ityaptin Work Items ---------- 1. Isolate code of polling agents and notification agent 2. Create a new package and repository with isolated codebase 3. Publish it as an Openstack project 4. Enable functional, tempest, devstack, grenade tests 5. Deprecate pipeline code in Ceilometer 6. Contribute to the a downstream switch-over effort to migrate existing Fedora/Deb packages and puppet modules. Future lifecycle ================ This Telemetry subproject will be able to be released on its own like the rest of the Openstack project/components. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= The tests coverage should be same, but we need to create separate tests for gate and Tempest. Documentation Impact ==================== The documentation should be updated to include info about new project under Telemetry umbrella. References ========== * Mitaka summit etherpad: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-telemetry-split

subject: Add a read preference for the MongoDB client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-30 10:12:53.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/mongo/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/40fe887652e927b3546680b4394d29e2c909c77a', 'message': "Add a read preference for the MongoDB client

Currently, if we use MongoDB Ceilometer backend
we can deploy MongoDB with ReplicaSet configuration
that provides a HA reliable data storaging.
In same time we use default MongoClient connection
that reads only from the Primary node by default.
So if Primary node falls Ceilometer can't read any data
from MongoDB during the voting (>1m in the worst case).

In this CR read preference is changed to the Primary preferred
what allows to use secondary nodes for the reading.

Change-Id: I6181ba4cda6779774f0a899d5019de266e3e0212
"}]
commit_message:
Add a read preference for the MongoDB client

Currently, if we use MongoDB Ceilometer backend
we can deploy MongoDB with ReplicaSet configuration
that provides a HA reliable data storaging.
In same time we use default MongoClient connection
that reads only from the Primary node by default.
So if Primary node falls Ceilometer can't read any data
from MongoDB during the voting (>1m in the worst case).

In this CR read preference is changed to the Primary preferred
what allows to use secondary nodes for the reading.

Change-Id: I6181ba4cda6779774f0a899d5019de266e3e0212
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/75/251275/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return MongoProxy( pymongo.MongoClient( url, read_preference=pymongo.ReadPreference.PRIMARY_PREFERRED))

commit_message:
Return 204 when download file from non-active image

Previously (In Liberty) when user tried to download file
from non-active image Glance returned 204. In Mitaka this
behavior was changed and now Glance returns 403.
It was done in the commit
d4d94b290ceb9147dd285822e201dd85ce812ef0

This is contrary to the Glance image api v2
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-image-v2.html
and we have to return the right value back.

If regular user tries to download deactivated image Glance
returns 403 as before.

Closes-bug: #1549869
ApiImpact

Change-Id: I2af3e330673eb862145e8fa09573aaa918e504a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/80/284780/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update parameters about authtoken middleware in proxy-server.conf.sample

This patch replaces some configration parameters about authtoken
middleware in proxy-server.conf, which will be deprecated.

The following parameters are to be deprecated.
 auth_admin_prefix, auth_host, auth_port, auth_protocol,
 identity_uri, admin_token, admin_user, admin_password,
 admin_tenant_name

Change-Id: I373734933189c87c4094203b0752dd3762689034

commit_message:
Set notification driver for nova to send

Currently since nova compute is not configured to
send notifications to ceilometer, tempest tests
fail on tempest.api.telemetry.test_telemetry_notification_api.

Change-Id: I763b7d246ae3f5955b6f555c8fd107d2cac89787

commit_message:
Check context before returning cached value

The key manager caches the value of barbican client to be reused,
saving an extra call to keystone.  The cached value is only
applicable to the current context, so the context must be checked
before returning the cached value.

Closes-Bug: #1523646

Change-Id: I7cd7f1ba8a749b230c611e4fb20ccf4127354c35

added_lines: --- - name: Ensuring the heka container is up kolla_docker: name: "heka" action: "get_container_state" register: container_state failed_when: container_state.Running == false - include: config.yml - name: Checking the heka config command: docker exec heka /usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs --check changed_when: false failed_when: false register: check_result - name: Getting the heka container config strategy kolla_docker: name: "heka" action: "get_container_env" register: container_env - name: Removing the heka container kolla_docker: name: "heka" action: "remove_container" register: remove_container when: - config_strategy == "COPY_ONCE" or container_env["KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY"] == "COPY_ONCE" - check_result.rc == 1 - include: start.yml when: remove_container.changed - name: Restarting the heka container kolla_docker: name: "heka" action: "restart_container" when: - config_strategy == "COPY_ALWAYS" - container_env["KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY"] == "COPY_ALWAYS" - check_result.rc == 1

commit_message:
Fix sed -i flag usage

We don't need to create any backup with e SUFFIX so let's just
remove -e flag since:
        the first non-option argument is taken as the sed
        script to interpret

Change-Id: I69d658254ebe75b07c818e8aa6fb405ff33db549

commit_message:
Ignore errorcode=4 when executing `cryptsetup remove` command

If an attached encrypted volume is failed to detach from the instance
when deleting that instance, user can not delete that instance at all.

This patch adds 4 in check_exit_code when executing `cryptsetup remove`
command to eat that exception.

PS: exit_code = 4 indicate ENODEV error which means no device(also includes
the crypt device inactive).

Closes-Bug: #1482066
Change-Id: I12e2a52068850528a4bd68486344b74eb9b82c88

'detach_volume') @mock.patch('nova.volume.encryptors.cryptsetup.CryptsetupEncryptor') @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver._get_volume_encryptor') @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver._undefine_domain') @mock.patch('nova.virt.driver.block_device_info_get_mapping') @mock.patch.object(libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver, 'delete_instance_files') def test_cleanup_encryption_lvm_failed(self, mock_delete, mock_bdm, mock_undefin_domain, mock_get_encry, mock_cry, mock_detach, mock_get_meta, mock_unfilter, mock_unplug): drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) fake_bdms = [{'connection_info': {'data': {'volume_id': 'id'}}, 'mount_device': None}] mock_instance = mock.MagicMock() mock_instance.system_metadata = {} mock_bdm.return_value = fake_bdms encryption = {'meta': 'fake'} mock_get_meta.return_value = encryption mock_get_encry.return_value = mock_cry mock_detach.side_effect = Exception drvr.cleanup('ctxt', mock_instance, 'netinfo') mock_detach.assert_called_once_with(**encryption)

config_strategy == "COPY_ONCE" or item[1]['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY'] == 'COPY_ONCE' - item[2]['rc'] == 1 - inventory_hostname in groups[item[0]['group']] with_together: - [{ name: mistral_api, group: mistral-api }, { name: mistral_engine, group: mistral-engine }, { name: mistral_executor, group: mistral-executor }] - container_envs.results - check_results.results - include: start.yml when: remove_containers.changed - name: Restart containers kolla_docker: name: "{{ item[0]['name'] }}" action: "restart_container" when: - config_strategy == 'COPY_ALWAYS' - item[1]['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY'] != 'COPY_ONCE' - item[2]['rc'] == 1 - inventory_hostname in groups[item[0]['group']] with_together: - [{ name: mistral_api, group: mistral-api }, { name: mistral_engine, group: mistral-engine }, { name: mistral_executor, group: mistral-executor }] - container_envs.results - check_results.results

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 15:33:17.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud_heat_plugins/server_update_allowed.py', 'undercloud_heat_plugins/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/f81bc051bcd450a11072180b33c7834b6e64951e', 'message': 'Override OS::Nova::Server for user_data updates

will not replace heat servers on stack-update when the user_data
property is changed.

heat-engine needs to be restarted to register the new plugin, so there
needs to be some mechanism to ensure this during an undercloud upgrade.
It might be possible to rely on puppet doing a service restart when

(cherry picked from commit 2fe97a4bf51853d1773c9f4eccfb0ca536f1ef35)
'}]
commit_message:
Override OS::Nova::Server for user_data updates

This change installs a plugin to /usr/lib/heat.
This plugin replaces the OS::Nova::Server type which is a subclass that
will not replace heat servers on stack-update when the user_data
property is changed.

heat-engine needs to be restarted to register the new plugin, so there
needs to be some mechanism to ensure this during an undercloud upgrade.
It might be possible to rely on puppet doing a service restart when
"openstack undercloud install" is run again during the upgrade. Testing
will reveal whether an explicity restart openstack-heat-engine is
needed.

Any undercloud heat can be tested for whether servers are replaced on
user_data changes by running:

  heat resource-type-show OS::Nova::Server | \
    jq '.properties.user_data.update_allowed'

The result will be 'true' when this change has been successfully
applied.

The intention is that this is backported to stable/liberty to allow
overclouds to be upgraded from kilo to liberty. This issue can be fixed
in heat for Mitaka but that heat change can't be backported to Liberty.

This will work as expected for existing overcloud stacks and their
OS::Nova::Server resouces - no resource will be replaced when
ServerUpdateAllowed becomes active.

Downstream packaging needs to do the same file copying as the setup.cfg
data_files entry, which is to copy the undercloud_heat_plugins directory
to /usr/lib/heat

Change-Id: Ibd2b70527977058d18c12ea71de7f302379c50aa
Closes-Bug: #1539541
(cherry picked from commit 2fe97a4bf51853d1773c9f4eccfb0ca536f1ef35)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/69/284769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lib/heat/undercloud_heat_plugins = undercloud_heat_plugins/*

commit_message:
Add couchdb to global requirements

Update global requirements to get couchdb library. This
is required for running the integration tests in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/270443/

The python library for couchdb is maintained at:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/CouchDB/1.0
This library is python 3 compatible. It carries the BSD license as well
as OSI approved. The code can be found at:
https://github.com/djc/couchdb-python/ and the testing results can be
viewed at: https://travis-ci.org/djc/couchdb-python. This is a new
requirement and the global-requirements.txt does not contain any
other libraries that covers any part of this functionality.

Change-Id: Iecb4552c50dfec3a5b31f60b0f1739eb4eb6e67a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/91/285191/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: couchdb>=1.0 # Apache-2.0

commit_message:
Update time is not updated when metadata of aggregate is updated

For example, When aggregate zone is updated, time is not getting updated
in updated_at field.

So, modified the code such that time gets updated in updated_at field
whenever the aggregate metadata content gets modified.

Change-Id: Icb65313ba85562fadeddbc1890ca5d463e74d3c2
Closes-Bug: #1538014
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/284023/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: aggregate.updated_at = timeutils.utcnow() aggregate.updated_at = timeutils.utcnow()

commit_message:
Revised Intro to TLS and SSL Chapter

Submitted revision to section in TLS SSL Chapter.

Closes-Bug: #1552013

Change-Id: I69939ee31dabdc0ab6119e4b031a217b227d9ec6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/12/287412/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: It is recommended that only TLSv1.2 is used. Other versions such as TLS 1.0 and 1.1 are vulnerable to multiple attacks. TLS 1.0 should be disabled completely in your environment. TLSv1.1 may be used for broad client compatibility however caution should be exercised when enabling this protocol, should only be done if there is a mandatory requirement and you are aware of the risks involved. Older versions of TLS, should not be used as these versions include SSLv2 which is deprecated, and SSLv3 which suffers from the attack known as POODLE. When using TLS v1.2 and in control of both the clients and the server, the cipher suite should be limited to ``ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384``. In circumstances where you dont control both ends and are using TLS 1.1 or 1.2 the more general ``HIGH:!aNULL:!eNULL:!DES:!3DES:!SSLv3:!TLSv1:!CAMELLIA`` is a reasonable cipher selection.
deleted_lines: We recommend only using TLSv1.2. TLSv1.0 and TLSv1.1 may be used for broad client compatibility but we recommend using caution and only enabling these protocols if you have a strong requirement to do so. Other TLS versions, explicitly older versions, should not be used. These older versions include SSLv2 which is deprecated, and SSLv3 which suffers from the attack known as POODLE. When using TLS v1.2 and in control of both the clients and the server, the cipher suite should be limited to ``ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384``. Where you don't control both ends and are using TLS v1+, the more general ``HIGH:!aNULL:!eNULL:!DES:!3DES`` is a reasonable cipher selection.

commit_message:
cloudkittyclient with keystone v3 not working

cloudkittyclient is failing to pass some domain/project related
information to keystoneclient, which caused "The service catalog
is empty" and "Expecting to find domain in project" error when
executing cloudkittyclient shell.

Change-Id: I386f4ecb38b947a1d8a0c8f1eee72e25ee12771a
Closes-Bug: #1547778

commit_message:
Support rerunning successful puppet tasks

This patch adds the ability to configure astute to retry successful
puppet runs immediately after a successful run. This will be used to
determine the idempotency of a given task. By default it is disabled,
but can be enabled by configuring puppet_succeed_retries in the astute
configuration file.

It will work for both methods: granular and task based deployments

Change-Id: If5af328b71067501cc2cb8d117e78287c1dcf1ad
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/37/273737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: conf[:puppet_succeed_retries] = 1 conf[:shell_succeed_retries] = 1

commit_message:
Set default NUMA topology distances

In case of one NUMA node `lstopo` doesn't return
information about distances, so by default distances
should be 2d array [["1.0"]]

Change-Id: I858c93e7f41b1a670bc72a80cd0c5b47fe63ef12
Partial-Bug: #1551955

added_lines: Tests for database migrations run a series of test cases to ensure that migrations work properly both upgrading and downgrading, and that no data loss occurs if possible.
deleted_lines: Tests for database migrations. This test case reads the configuration file /tests/unit/test_migrations.conf for database connection settings to use in the tests. For each connection found in the config file, the test case runs a series of test cases to ensure that migrations work properly both upgrading and downgrading, and that no data loss occurs if possible.

commit_message:
Migrate the snapshot or the clone instead of the volume

If the volume is not locked by setting to the status of
'maintenance', other API actions may terminate the migration.
In this case, we need to migrate the snapshot or the clone
of the source volume for easier migration termination.

This patch is the basic work to implement the migration
termination caused by other API actions. If the snapshot
of the source can be provided a valid local path, we take
the snapshot for further copy. Otherwise we take the clone
for further copy.

Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement
Change-Id: I12a8193302cac68fbc0f37c5772cdf84667d50f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/86/250586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy snapshot_clone_ready = False temp_snapshot_clone = None source_device = src_vol if src_vol['status'] == 'available': if src_vol_path: # Since the driver provides a valid local path and # the source volume is available, we create a temporary # snapshot for migration. temp_snapshot_clone = {'volume_name': src_vol['name'], 'size': src_vol['size'], 'volume_size': src_vol['size'], 'name': 'clone-snap-%s' % src_vol['id'], 'id': 'tmp-snap-%s' % src_vol['id']} try: self.driver.create_snapshot(temp_snapshot_clone) src_vol_path = self.driver.local_path(temp_snapshot_clone) snapshot_clone_ready = True except Exception: LOG.error(_LE("Failed to create the snapshot, so the " "source volume will be used directly.")) src_vol_path = None else: # Since the driver does not provide a valid local path # and the source volume is available, we create a # temporary clone for migration. src_vol_path = None temp_id = 'tmp-clone-%s' % src_vol['id'] temp_name = 'clone-snap-%s' % src_vol['id'] temp_snapshot_clone = copy.deepcopy(src_vol) temp_snapshot_clone['name'] = temp_name temp_snapshot_clone['id'] = temp_id try: self.driver.create_cloned_volume(self, temp_snapshot_clone, src_vol) source_device = temp_snapshot_clone snapshot_clone_ready = True except Exception: LOG.error(_LE("Failed to create the clone, so the " "source volume will be used directly.")) src_attach_info = self._attach_volume(ctxt, source_device, self._detach_volume(ctxt, src_attach_info, source_device, if snapshot_clone_ready: self.driver.delete_volume(temp_snapshot_clone) elif snapshot_clone_ready: self.driver.delete_snapshot(temp_snapshot_clone)
deleted_lines: src_attach_info = self._attach_volume(ctxt, src_vol, self._detach_volume(ctxt, src_attach_info, src_vol,

commit_message:
Glance: Some Image service API does not have "Error response codes"

This patch add new or updates "Error response codes" in description of
below APIs to include "ItemNotFound (404)" Error response code.

Change-Id: Ia96d26b07ee8f61eac345d0c5b781f98c925e108
Closes-Bug: #1549587

commit_message:
Update new user secrets in Liberty

The user-secrets-adjustments.yml playbook introduced for Kilo upgrades
is brought foward to Liberty in this commit. Since the task is logically
the same and new secrets variables were introduced, no changes from the
Kilo version are made. The documentation is updated to be more clear
about how existing secrets are handled.

Change-Id: I029b41d379d3cf3e073c7e004a9eb7986c56d1f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/44/286844/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RUN_TASKS+=("${UPGRADE_PLAYBOOKS}/user-secrets-adjustment.yml")

Change-Id: I99d85652d223a5d7a55fb08d42249c49a5356c90
'}]
commit_message:
Documentation for scaling policy v1.0

This patch adds documentation for the scaling policy v1.0.

Change-Id: I99d85652d223a5d7a55fb08d42249c49a5356c90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/04/284504/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: used for scaling in/out a cluster. Senlin does provide a more complicated API for resizing a cluster (i.e. ``cluster_resize``), however, in some use cases, we cannot assume the requesters have all the factors to determine each and every detailed parameters for resizing a cluster. There are cases where the only thing a requester knows for sure is that a cluster should be scaled out, or be scaled in. A scaling policy helps derive appropriate, quantitative parameters for such a request. Note that when calculating the target capacity of the cluster, Senlin only considers the **ACTIVE** nodes. Applicable Profiles ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The policy is designed to handle any (``ANY``) profile types. Actions Handled ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The policy is capable of handling the following actions: - ``CLUSTER_SCALE_IN``: an action that carries an optional integer value named ``count`` in its ``inputs``. - ``CLUSTER_SCALE_OUT``: an action that carries an optional integer value named ``count`` in its ``inputs``. The policy will be checked **BEFORE** any of the above mentioned actions is executed. Because the same policy implementation is used for covering both the cases of scaling out a cluster and the cases of scaling in, the scaling policy exposes a "``event``" property to differentiate a policy instance. This is purely an implementation convenience. Senlin engine respects the user-provided "``count``" input parameter if it is specified. Or else, the policy computes a ``count`` value based on the policy's ``adjustment`` property. In both cases, the policy will validate the targeted capacity against the cluster's size constraints. After validating the ``count`` value, the deletion policy proceeds to update the ``data`` property of the action based on the validation result. If the validation fails, the ``data`` property of the action will be updated to something similar to the following example: :: { "status": "ERROR", "reason": "The target capacity (3) is less than cluster's min_size (2)." } If the validation succeeds, the ``data`` property of the action is updated accordingly (see Senarios below). Scenarios ~~~~~~~~~ S1: ``CLUSTER_SCALE_IN`` ------------------------ The request may carry a "``count``" parameter in the action's ``inputs`` field. The scaling policy respects the user input if provided, or else it will calculate the number of nodes to be removed based on other properties of the policy. In either case, the policy will check if the ``count`` value is a positive integer (or it can be convert to one). In the next step, the policy check if the "``best_effort``" property has been set to ``True`` (default is ``False``). When the value is ``True``, the policy will attempt to use the actual difference between the cluster's minimum size and its current capacity rather than the ``count`` value if the latter is greater than the former. When the proper ``count`` value is generated and passes validation, the policy updates the ``action`` property of the action into something like the following example: :: { "status": "OK", "reason": "Scaling request validated.", "deletion": { "count": 2 } } S2: ``CLUSTER_SCALE_OUT`` ------------------------- The request may carry a "``count``" parameter in the action's ``inputs`` field. The scaling policy respects the user input if provided, or else it will calculate the number of nodes to be added based on other properties of the policy. In either case, the policy will check if the ``count`` value is a positive integer (or it can be convert to one). In the next step, the policy check if the "``best_effort``" property has been set to ``True`` (default is ``False``). When the value is ``True``, the policy will attempt to use the actual difference between the cluster's maximum size and its current capacity rather than the ``count`` value if the latter is greater than the former. When the proper ``count`` value is generated and passes validation, the policy updates the ``action`` property of the action into something like the following example: :: { "status": "OK", "reason": "Scaling request validated.", "creation": { "count": 2 } } S3: Cross-region or Cross-AZ Scaling ------------------------------------ When scaling a cluster across multiple regions or multiple availability zones, the scaling policy will be evaluated before the :doc:`region placement policy <region_placement_v1>` or the :doc:`zone placement policy <zone_placement_v1>` respectively. Based on builtin priority settings, checking of this scaling policy always happen before the region placement policy or the zone placement policy. The ``creation.count`` or ``deletion.count`` field is expected to be respected by the region placement or zone placement policy. In other words, those placement policies will base their calculation of node distribution on the ``creation.count`` or ``deletion.count`` value respectively.
deleted_lines: used for scaling in/out a cluster.

subject: Fixed _winreg OpenKey parameter On 64-bit Windows systems the iSCSI initiatorname wasn't picked up from the registry, because the path parameter given to winreg.OpenKey is different than on 32-bit systems. Using 32-bit Python opened the registry in 32-bit view where the required key was missing. This patch fixes the issue by forcing Python to open the registry in 64-bit view

commit_message:
Fixed _winreg OpenKey parameter
On 64-bit Windows systems the iSCSI initiatorname wasn't picked up from the registry, because the path parameter given to winreg.OpenKey is different than on 32-bit systems. Using 32-bit Python opened the registry in 32-bit view where the required key was missing. This patch fixes the issue by forcing Python to open the registry in 64-bit view

Change-Id: I373ff56de26fa9f110764d87dd838e8146c056da
Signed-off-by: Domonkos Tomcsanyi <tomcsanyid@modit.hu>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/06/288406/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (_winreg.KEY_WOW64_64KEY +_winreg.KEY_ALL_ACCESS))

subject: Add ability to failback for replication V2.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 01:20:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/5c5bc218e35a02a6480dec426bfbeef0062af887', 'message': 'Add ability to failback for replication V2.1

Initially we had setup replication V2.1 (Cheesecake) to NOT
do fail-back at least in the initial version.

It turns out that fail-back in the Cinder code is rather easy,
we just enable calling failover-host on a host that's already
failed-over and use the *special* keyword of "default" as the
backend_id argument which signifies we want to switch back to
whatever is configured as the default in the cinder.conf file.

To do this we just add some logic that checks the secondary_backend_id
param in volume.manager:failover_host and set service fields
appropriately.  Note that we're sending the call to the driver
first and giving it a chance to raise an exception if it can't
satisfy the request at the current time.

We also needed to modify the volume.api:failover_host to allow
failed-over as a valid transition state, and again update the
Service query to include disabled services.

It's up to drivers to figure out if they want to require some
extra admin steps and document exactly how this works.  It's also
possible that during an initial failover that you might want to
return a status update for all volumes NOT replicated and mark
their volume-status to "error".

Expected behavior is depicted in the service output here:
    http://paste.openstack.org/show/488294/

Change-Id: I4531ab65424a7a9600b2f93ee5b5e1a0dd47d63d

commit_message:
Add ability to failback for replication V2.1

Initially we had setup replication V2.1 (Cheesecake) to NOT
do fail-back at least in the initial version.

It turns out that fail-back in the Cinder code is rather easy,
we just enable calling failover-host on a host that's already
failed-over and use the *special* keyword of "default" as the
backend_id argument which signifies we want to switch back to
whatever is configured as the default in the cinder.conf file.

To do this we just add some logic that checks the secondary_backend_id
param in volume.manager:failover_host and set service fields
appropriately.  Note that we're sending the call to the driver
first and giving it a chance to raise an exception if it can't
satisfy the request at the current time.

We also needed to modify the volume.api:failover_host to allow
failed-over as a valid transition state, and again update the
Service query to include disabled services.

It's up to drivers to figure out if they want to require some
extra admin steps and document exactly how this works.  It's also
possible that during an initial failover that you might want to
return a status update for all volumes NOT replicated and mark
their volume-status to "error".

Expected behavior is depicted in the service output here:
    http://paste.openstack.org/show/488294/

Change-Id: I4531ab65424a7a9600b2f93ee5b5e1a0dd47d63d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/07/285007/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: service = objects.Service.get_by_args( expected = {'replication_status': [fields.ReplicationStatus.ENABLED, fields.ReplicationStatus.FAILED_OVER]}

subject: Make database/telemetry clients use rest_client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 17:47:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/7a31a428baea2853180b938da762677316d6ef66', 'message': 'Make database/telemetry clients use rest_client

Now service_client is unnecessary because that is the same as
rest_client. This patch makes database and telemetry clients
use the rest_client, and we will remove service_client for the
cleanup in the future.

This patch removes these clients from a certain test because
this test is just for service_client, not rest_client as the
test name. We have added this test for verifying all arguments
are passed into rest_client via service_client. However, this
patch some clients use rest_client directly, so this test becomes
meaningless for these clients. That is a reason why the migrated
clients(into tempest.lib before) are not contained in this test.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
Make database/telemetry clients use rest_client

Now service_client is unnecessary because that is the same as
rest_client. This patch makes database and telemetry clients
use the rest_client, and we will remove service_client for the
cleanup in the future.

This patch removes these clients from a certain test because
this test is just for service_client, not rest_client as the
test name. We have added this test for verifying all arguments
are passed into rest_client via service_client. However, this
patch some clients use rest_client directly, so this test becomes
meaningless for these clients. That is a reason why the migrated
clients(into tempest.lib before) are not contained in this test.

NOTE: This patch changes __init__() of versions_client to use
      **kwargs because service_client removed them if each value
      is None, but rest_client doesn't do it. The purpose of the
      __init__() is just for calling self.skip_path(), so this
      change is more readable also.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ie99bbbe7655138c4c3ecae69ae0b361198a9651d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/43/287343/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from tempest.common import service_client class TelemetryClient(service_client.ServiceClient): return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) return service_client.ResponseBodyList(resp, body) return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body)

commit_message:
Doc on how to set up a thirdparty project

This documentation is a pre-requisite to all plugin documentation
as it guides you through the creation of a project from scratch
instead of simply forcusing on the implementation of the plugin
itself.

Change-Id: Id2e09b3667390ee6c4be42454c41f9d266fdfac2
Related-Bug: #1534639
Related-Bug: #1533739

commit_message:
Update node names in destroy_vms

As of the testenv rebuilds the libvirt domain names have changed
format. Our destroy_vms function needs to be updated so we can
continue to destroy domains after each job and overcommit on RAM
in the way we do.

Change-Id: I57df728257b779c3a8ac539e9492a11a0dd8d4f9

commit_message:
Make image clients use rest_client

Now service_client is unnecessary because that is the same as
rest_client. This patch makes image clients use the rest_client,
and we will remove service_client for the cleanup in the future.

This patch removes these clients from a certain test because this
test is just for service_client, not rest_client as the test name.
We have added this test for verifying all arguments are passed into
rest_client via service_client. However, this patch some clients use
rest_client directly, so this test becomes meaningless for these
clients. That is a reason why the migrated clients(into tempest.lib
before) are not contained in this test.

NOTE: This patch changes __init__() of images_client to use
      **kwargs because service_client removed them if each value
      is None, but rest_client doesn't do it. The purpose of the
      __init__() is just for calling self.skip_path(), so this
      change is more readable also.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I6655b31239d4f3d0c4601b875a4a26778fc9dd2d

added_lines: Retrieve and install CloudKitty's dashboard: :: git clone git://git.openstack.org/openstack/cloudkitty-dashboard cd cloudkitty-dashboard python setup.py install Find where the python packages are installed: :: PY_PACKAGES_PATH=`pip --version | cut -d' ' -f4` Then add the enabled file to the horizon settings or installation. Depending on your setup, you might need to add it to ``/usr/share`` or directly in the horizon python package: :: # If horizon is installed by packages: ln -s $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/cloudkittydashboard/enabled/_[0-9]*.py \ /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/enabled/ # Directly from sources: ln -s $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/cloudkittydashboard/enabled/_[0-9]*.py \ $PY_PACKAGES_PATH/openstack_dashboard/enabled/ Restart the web server hosting Horizon. For more detailed information about CloudKitty's installation check the `installation section`_ of the documentation. .. _installation section: https://cloudkitty.readthedocs.org/en/latest/installation.html
deleted_lines: At the command line:: $ pip install cloudkitty-dashboard Or, if you have virtualenvwrapper installed:: $ mkvirtualenv cloudkitty-dashboard $ pip install cloudkitty-dashboard

commit_message:
Use bindep for manual jobs

Use ubuntu-trusty for most manual jobs.

* Remove experimental-docu-bindep-jobs.
* Create new gate-{name}-tox-nodb-{envlist} that uses bindep but does
  not setup databases.
* Move {name}-tox-doc-{envlist} from api-jobs to manuals-jobs and
  change to use bindep.
* Rename gate-{name}-tox-doc-publish-{envlist}-bindep to
  gate-{name}-tox-doc-publish-{envlist}.

Update everything in Zuul for these changes.

Change-Id: Ia075c2dfadd23ee7814b84d0813d56c3f6d872d2

commit_message:
Add reworked version of gerrit client

Split gerrit client across 3 files

Rework gerrit_client.py toward simple and direct interface between
functional code and Gerrit Rest API

Pull common utility functions into utils.py

Add gerrit_info_provider.py and pull parsing changed modules from
review into it

Add DependencyProvider and its initial implementation

Closes-Bug: #1551640
Change-Id: I54efc625ff74037a88efe64795bd151be3f4ba89

commit_message:
Make network clients use rest_client

Now service_client is unnecessary because that is the same as
rest_client. This patch makes network clients use the rest_client,
and we will remove service_client for the cleanup in the future.

This patch removes these clients from a certain test because this
test is just for service_client, not rest_client as the test name.
We have added this test for verifying all arguments are passed into
rest_client via service_client. However, this patch some clients use
rest_client directly, so this test becomes meaningless for these
clients. That is a reason why the migrated clients(into tempest.lib
before) are not contained in this test.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I1922d0937162827f5c720bf3d331f9c7695506d2

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for list deleted instances on v2.16

There is a bug such that listing deleted instances with microversion
2.16 and greater is broken. It results in a 404. This adds a functional
regression test to exhibit the failure. The fix will build on the test
to show it's working again.

Change-Id: Ifca42c23e2ead2b533776365de29f874819cb2a8
Related-Bug: #1548980

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 HPE, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import time from oslo_config import cfg import nova.scheduler.utils import nova.servicegroup from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional.api import client from nova.tests.unit import cast_as_call import nova.tests.unit.image.fake from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture CONF = cfg.CONF class TestServerGet(test.TestCase): REQUIRES_LOCKING = True def setUp(self): super(TestServerGet, self).setUp() self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.16')) self.api = api_fixture.api self.admin_api = api_fixture.admin_api # the image fake backend needed for image discovery nova.tests.unit.image.fake.stub_out_image_service(self) self.start_service('conductor', manager=CONF.conductor.manager) self.flags(scheduler_driver='chance_scheduler') self.start_service('scheduler') self.network = self.start_service('network') self.compute = self.start_service('compute') self.addCleanup(self.compute.kill) self.useFixture(cast_as_call.CastAsCall(self.stubs)) self.addCleanup(nova.tests.unit.image.fake.FakeImageService_reset) self.image_id = self.api.get_images()[0]['id'] self.flavor_id = self.api.get_flavors()[0]['id'] def test_list_deleted_instances(self): """Regression test for bug #1548980. Before fixing this bug, listing deleted instances returned a 404 because lazy-loading services from a deleted instance failed. Now we should be able to list the deleted instance and the host_state attribute should be "". """ server = dict(name='server1', imageRef=self.image_id, flavorRef=self.flavor_id) server = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) # TODO(mriedem): wait for active time.sleep(1) self.api.delete_server(server['id']) # TODO(mriedem): wait for deleted time.sleep(1) self.assertRaises(client.OpenStackApiNotFoundException, self.admin_api.get_servers, search_opts={'deleted': 1})

commit_message:
Specify temporary upload dir for Horizon

By default horizon firstly uploads image to /tmp directory
and pushes it to glance then. Sometimes a lack of free space
in /tmp dir may cause cluster going offline.

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/horizon.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/spec/classes/openstack_horizon_spec.rb
	deployment/puppet/openstack/templates/horizon/wsgi_vhost_custom.erb
	deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/horizon/horizon.pp

Change-Id: Iae9f2dddb6fe6d1b350b4467599813e69e01a15d
Closes-Bug: #1496838
Depends-On: I7cb9edd3f6a31b86696d708c525cf8d031642c58

commit_message:
Make volume clients use rest_client

Now service_client is unnecessary because that is the same as
rest_client. This patch makes volume clients use the rest_client,
and we will remove service_client for the cleanup in the future.

This patch removes these clients from a certain test because this
test is just for service_client, not rest_client as the test name.
We have added this test for verifying all arguments are passed into
rest_client via service_client. However, this patch some clients use
rest_client directly, so this test becomes meaningless for these
clients. That is a reason why the migrated clients(into tempest.lib
before) are not contained in this test.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I1f7d8bfdb23500342984508333321422f8e2366b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/70/287370/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
